schema_version.hidden comment: Bump the default in the subclasses.

alternate_accessions.description: Accessions previously assigned to objects that have been merged with this object.
alternate_accessions.comment: Do not submit. Only admins are allowed to set or update this value.
alternate_accessions.title: Alternate accessions

items.description: An accession previously assigned to an object that has been merged with this object.
items.comment: Only accessions of objects that have status equal replaced will work here.
items.title: Alternate accession

external_ids.description: External identifiers that uniquely identify the donor of the sample, e.g. for strains it might be a strain identifier at a repository or a de-identified donor ID for a person.
external_ids.comment: List of identifiers that are used by external resources that can be used to identify samples from that particular donor or strain.
external_ids.title: Unique external identifier(s) of strain or donor

items.description: External identifier that uniquely identify the donor of the sample, e.g. for strains it might be a strain identifier at a repository or a de-identified donor ID for a person.

external_ids.title: Unique external identifier(s) of strain or donor

description: Schema for submitting a human donor.
title: Human donor

age_units.comment: Age units is required if age is specified as anything but unknown.

twin_type.comment: Twin type could be specified only if twin sibling is specified.

internal_tags.comment: If internal_tags list is initiated, it must contain at least one value.

comment: This object is meant to be one to one with an individual human.

___internal_tags.description: Some human donors are part of particular data collections
___internal_tags.comment: Do not submit. DCC personnel is responsible for submission of this property.
___internal_tags.title: Internal tags

___parents.comment: This is a link for cases when families are all donors in our system. Children will be calculated from this link.
___parents.title: Parents

items.comment: For human biosamples, see human_donor.json for available identifiers.
items.title: Parent

___age.description: The age or age range of the donor when biological material was sampled.
___age.comment: This is gestational time for fetal and embryonic samples. We allow a generic over 90 for privacy purposes.
___age.title: Age

___ethnicity.comment: We use http://bioportal.bioontology.org/ontologies/SNOMED-Ethnic-Group as a template for the enum list of ethnicities.
___ethnicity.title: Ethnicity

___siblings.description: Donors that have at least one parent in common with this donor.
___siblings.comment: This is a link for cases when families are all donors in our system.
___siblings.title: Siblings

items.description: A donor that has at least one parent in common.
items.comment: For human biosamples, see human_donor.json for available identifiers.
items.title: Sibling

___organism.comment: Do not submit, value is assigned by the object.

___dbxrefs.description: Identifiers from external resources that may have 1-to-1 or 1-to-many relationships with ENCODE objects.
___dbxrefs.comment: Do not submit. DCC personnel is responsible for submission of donor external resource identifiers.
___dbxrefs.title: External resources

items.description: Identifier an from external resource that may have 1-to-1 or 1-to-many relationships with ENCODE objects.
items.title: Database external identifier

___twin.description: A human donor that is a twin sibling of this human donor.
___twin.comment: For human biosamples, see human_donor.json for available identifiers.
___twin.title: Twin

___twin_type.comment: The type of the twin sibling of this donor (dizygotic or monozygotic)
___twin_type.title: Twin type
